tgt_fact_aligned_sentences: A dosa (known locally as dosey, dosaë, dosai, dosha, dose, or dhosa) is a thin, savoury crepe in Indian cuisine made from a fermented batter of ground black gram and rice.
A dosa (known locally as dosey, dosaë, dosai, dosha, dose, or dhosa) is a thin, savoury crepe in Indian cuisine made from a fermented batter of ground black gram and rice.
Dosas are served hot, often with chutney and sambar (a lentil-based vegetable stew).
The dosa originated in South India, but its precise geographical origins are unknown.
